essay: The first issue of the Star of the South was published in Elberton on August 6, 1859 by Eberhart and Hutchinson. By 1860, however, J. T. McCarty is listed as the owner, and Henry C. Ware as the editor. The paper was printed weekly and could be subscribed to for two dollars a year. The newspaper was short-lived and ceased publication in the 1860s.
